note_text:
Diagnostic Bronchoscopy Note
Procedures:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy with BAL
2. Transbronchial biopsies (forceps) for suspected sarcoidosis
Patient: Charlene King, 48-year-old female with bilateral hilar adenopathy and pulmonary nodules.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl.
Findings: Cobblestoning and mild nodularity at segmental bronchi; otherwise normal airways.
Sampling: BAL in right middle lobe; six fluoroscopy-guided transbronchial biopsies from right lower lobe medial basal segment.
Complications: No significant bleeding; postprocedure CXR negative for pneumothorax.
Disposition: Discharged home after observation.

registry_entry.note_text:
Diagnostic Bronchoscopy Note

1. Flexible bronchoscopy with BAL
2. Transbronchial biopsies (forceps) for suspected sarcoidosis

Sampling: BAL in right middle lobe; six fluoroscopy-guided transbronchial biopsies from right lower lobe medial basal segment.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Bilateral hilar adenopathy and perilymphatic nodules
registry_entry.prior_therapy: Short course of steroids with incomplete evaluation
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Bronchoscopy with BAL and TBBx for ILD/sarcoidosis
registry_entry.bronch_specimen_tests: Histology, special stains, BAL for CD4/CD8 and cultures
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Noncaseating granulomas on preliminary pathology; final stains pending
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Clinic visit in 2 weeks to discuss pathology and treatment

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy (Right lower lobe). Different lobe from BAL, generally separately reportable.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Codes 31624 and 31628 are supported by the documentation of BAL and TBLB in separate lobes.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe

coding_review.rationale: Flexible bronchoscopy with BAL in the right middle lobe and transbronchial lung biopsies in the right lower lobe for suspected sarcoidosis/ILD. 31624 captures the diagnostic bronchoscopy with BAL and 31628 captures the transbronchial lung biopsies in a different lobe; no navigation, EBUS, or ablation services are documented.

note_text:
ICU Bedside Bronchoscopy Note
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with BAL and mucus plug removal
Patient: Anthony Rogers, 68-year-old male intubated in ICU with lobar collapse and hypoxemic respiratory failure.
Setting: MICU bedside on mechanical ventilation.
Findings: Thick mucus plugs obstructing right lower lobe basal bronchi with complete lobar collapse on prior CXR.
Intervention: Aggressive saline lavage, suctioning, and BAL performed in RLL. Plugs removed and airways cleared.
Complications: Transient desaturation to 84% during lavage, resolved with recruitment.
Disposition: Remained intubated in ICU.

registry_entry.note_text:

registry_entry.primary_indication: Diagnostic and therapeutic bronchoscopy for lobar collapse in ventilated patient
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Complete right lower lobe collapse with mucus plugging on CT
registry_entry.anesthesia_agents: Propofol infusion, fentanyl drip, neuromuscular blockade held during procedure
registry_entry.bronch_indication: ICU bedside bronchoscopy for mucus plugging
registry_entry.bronch_specimen_tests: BAL sent for cell count and cultures
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Atelectasis due to mucus plugging; plugs removed
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Repeat CXR to document re-expansion; continue airway clearance strategies

code_rationales.31624: Bronchoscopy with BAL. Documentation mentions 'BAL performed'. Mucus plug removal in this context is often part of the bronchial toilet/lavage or bundled.

coding_review.overall_assessment: 31624 is appropriate for bronchoscopy with BAL.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage

coding_review.rationale: ICU bedside bronchoscopy with BAL and mucus plug removal in the right lower lobe. No biopsies, tumor ablation, navigation, or EBUS are documented, so 31624 alone appropriately captures the service; mucus plug removal is included in the bronchoscopy work.

note_text:
Transbronchial Cryobiopsy Note
Procedure: Bronchoscopic cryobiopsy for fibrotic ILD
Patient: Jennifer Adams, 56-year-old female with progressive fibrotic interstitial lung disease of unclear etiology.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.5 ETT.
Details: Bronchoscope advanced to left lower lobe basal segments. Radial EBUS used to identify parenchymal sites distant from large vessels. Three cryobiopsies obtained using 1.9 mm cryoprobe and one standard forceps biopsy. Bronchial blocker placed prophylactically.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with blocker inflation and iced saline; no pneumothorax on postprocedure CXR.
Disposition: Admitted overnight to monitored bed.

registry_entry.note_text:

registry_entry.primary_indication: Cryobiopsy for diagnosis of fibrotic ILD
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Peripheral reticulation and traction bronchiectasis in lower lobes
registry_entry.bronch_specimen_tests: Histology, special stains for HP vs UIP pattern
registry_entry.bronch_immediate_complications: Mild bleeding controlled with bronchial blocker
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Adequate cryobiopsy specimens obtained; ILD pattern pending
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: ILD clinic visit after pathology and multidisciplinary review

code_rationales.31654: Radial EBUS used for peripheral lesion guidance (add-on).
code_rationales.removed_31645: Therapeutic aspiration (31645) removed; no specific therapeutic aspiration documented beyond biopsy bleeding management.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Replaced 31645 with 31654 (Radial EBUS) as documented. 31628 covers the biopsy.

changes: Corrected CPTs: Removed 31645, added 31654 (REBUS). Added coding_review.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung cryobiopsy or therapeutic aspiration
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe

coding_review.rationale: Transbronchial cryobiopsies plus additional forceps biopsies are documented for ILD evaluation. 31645 captures the transbronchial cryobiopsy work and 31628 accounts for additional transbronchial lung biopsy sampling per internal ILD biopsy guidance; no navigation add-on or EBUS codes are supported beyond this.

note_text:
Robotic Bronchoscopic Radiofrequency Ablation Note
Procedure: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy with RF ablation of RLL metastasis
Patient: Kevin White, 63-year-old male with oligometastatic colorectal cancer and 10 mm RLL nodule.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 ETT.
Navigation: Ion robotic system used to access RLL lateral basal segment. CT-to-body registration error 2.0 mm. Radial EBUS confirmed solid lesion, cone-beam CT verified tool-in-lesion.
Ablation: RF ablation catheter advanced; ablation performed at 40 W for 480 seconds, peak temperature 85°C. Postablation CBCT showed ablation zone with ~5 mm margin.
Complications: Small perilesional hemorrhage, hemodynamically stable.
Disposition: Admitted overnight to telemetry.

registry_entry.note_text:

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: 10 mm RLL lateral basal pulmonary nodule
registry_entry.lesion_location: Right lower lobe lateral basal segment
registry_entry.nav_rebus_view: Concentric radial EBUS view of lesion
registry_entry.nav_imaging_verification: Cone-beam CT before and after ablation
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Bronchoscopic RF ablation of RLL metastasis

registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Oligometastatic colorectal metastasis treated with bronchoscopic RF ablation
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: CT chest in 3 months to assess ablation zone

coding_review.overall_assessment: Added 31654 for documented Radial EBUS use.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with excision or destruction of endobronchial tumor or lesion
Computer-assisted, image-guided navigational bronchoscopy (add-on)

coding_review.rationale: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and cone-beam CT guidance to perform radiofrequency ablation of a right lower lobe metastasis. 31641 captures bronchoscopic tumor destruction and +31627 captures the documented use of computer-assisted navigation; there is no separate pleural drain or additional bronchoscopic procedure to code.

note_text:
Bronchoscopic Microwave Ablation Note
Procedure: EMN-guided microwave ablation of left upper lobe peripheral nodule
Patient: Teresa Murphy, 60-year-old female with small presumed primary NSCLC not surgical candidate.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.5 ETT.
Navigation: superDimension EMN platform used to access 14 mm LUL anterior segment nodule. Radial EBUS showed eccentric view; cone-beam CT confirmed antenna in lesion.
Ablation: Emprint microwave antenna delivered via extended working channel, 65 W for 360 seconds, peak temperature 100°C. Postablation CBCT demonstrated appropriate ablation zone.
Complications: Mild hemoptysis (~20 mL) and small left apical pneumothorax requiring 10 Fr pigtail catheter.
Disposition: Admitted to monitored bed.

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter (pigtail) with imaging guidance (Fluoro/CXR).

coding_review.overall_assessment: Added 31654 (REBUS). Confirmed 32557 for guided chest tube placement.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with excision or destruction of endobronchial tumor or lesion
Computer-assisted, image-guided navigational bronchoscopy (add-on)
Image-guided placement of indwelling pleural catheter or pigtail chest tube

coding_review.rationale: EMN-guided bronchoscopic microwave ablation of a left upper lobe peripheral NSCLC with radial EBUS and cone-beam CT plus treatment pneumothorax requiring a pigtail chest catheter. 31641 has been added to capture bronchoscopic tumor destruction, +31627 captures computer-assisted navigation, and 32557 captures image-guided chest tube placement; this resolves the prior issue of navigation being billed without a primary bronchoscopic ablation code.

note_text:
Bronchoscopic Cryoablation Note
Procedure: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy with cryoablation of subpleural RUL lesion
Patient: Brian Edwards, 71-year-old male with small peripheral NSCLC and severe COPD.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 ETT.
Navigation: Monarch robotic system used to reach 12 mm RUL apical segment lesion. Radial EBUS confirmed lesion; CBCT demonstrated tip within lesion.
Ablation: 2.4 mm cryoprobe advanced through working channel; two freeze–thaw cycles of 360 seconds each performed. Ice ball seen on CBCT encompassing lesion with ~4–5 mm margin.
Complications: Mild transient hemoptysis; no pneumothorax on immediate imaging.
Disposition: Admitted overnight for observation.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with excision or destruction of endobronchial tumor or lesion
Computer-assisted, image-guided navigational bronchoscopy (add-on)

coding_review.rationale: Monarch robotic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS, cone-beam confirmation, and cryoablation of a small right-upper-lobe NSCLC. 31641 has been added to capture bronchoscopic tumor destruction by cryotherapy and +31627 captures the documented use of navigational bronchoscopy; there is no chest tube or other separate pleural procedure to bill.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA
Patient: James Carter, 64-year-old male with a right upper lobe mass and PET-avid mediastinal adenopathy.
Indication: Mediastinal staging prior to possible surgical resection.
Setting: Bronchoscopy suite at Naval Medical Center Atlantic. General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation (8.0 mm), volume control ventilation.
Bronchoscopic findings: Normal vocal cords and central airways without endobronchial tumor. No endobronchial obstruction.
EBUS procedure: Olympus BF-UC180F scope introduced via ETT. Systematic survey performed. Enlarged nodes visualized at stations 4R, 7, and 11R. Three passes obtained from each station using a 21G Olympus Vizishot needle. ROSE showed malignant cells at 4R concerning for non-small cell lung cancer; stations 7 and 11R showed benign lymphocytes.
Elastography used, demonstrating heterogeneous (blue-predominant) pattern at 4R and homogeneous green pattern at 7 and 11R. No intranodal forceps biopsies were performed.
Complications: Minimal bleeding at puncture sites controlled with suction; estimated blood loss 5 mL. No hypoxia, pneumothorax, or hemodynamic instability.
Disposition: Patient extubated in the procedure room, observed in PACU, then discharged home the same day with routine postbronchoscopy instructions. Plan for follow-up visit in 1 week to review final pathology and complete staging.

Three passes obtained from each station using a 21G Olympus Vizishot needle. ROSE showed malignant cells at 4R concerning for non-small cell lung cancer; stations 7 and 11R showed benign lymphocytes.
Elastography used, demonstrating heterogeneous (blue-predominant) pattern at 4R and homogeneous green pattern at 7 and 11R. No intranodal forceps biopsies were performed.
Complications: Minimal bleeding at puncture sites controlled with suction; estimated blood loss 5 mL. No hypoxia, pneumothorax, or hemodynamic instability.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal staging for right upper lobe mass
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with 3.2 cm RUL mass and enlarged 4R, 7, 11R lymph nodes; PET-avid
registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: 4R: malignant cells suspicious for NSCLC; 7 and 11R: benign lymphocytes
registry_entry.ebus_stations_detail: Three passes per station with adequate lymphocytes on ROSE.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: EBUS-TBNA for mediastinal staging in suspected lung cancer
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: 4R lymph node positive for malignancy, consistent with NSCLC
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Clinic follow-up in 1 week to review final pathology and complete staging workup

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA of 3 or more stations (4R, 7, 11R sampled). 31652 is mutually exclusive.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Corrected EBUS coding to 31653 (3+ stations) only.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA of single mediastinal or hilar node station
Linear EBUS-TBNA of each additional mediastinal or hilar node station

coding_review.rationale: Systematic linear EBUS-TBNA of stations 4R, 7, and 11R for mediastinal staging of a right upper lobe NSCLC. 31652 appropriately covers the first nodal station and 31653 covers additional stations. Radial EBUS for a peripheral lesion is not documented, so the prior 31654 radial add-on has been removed to avoid unsubstantiated billing.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA under monitored anesthesia care
Patient: Maria Hernandez, 58-year-old female with biopsy-proven left upper lobe adenocarcinoma and PET-avid mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
Indication: Mediastinal and hilar staging prior to definitive therapy.
Setting: Naval Medical Center Atlantic bronchoscopy suite. Monitored anesthesia care using propofol infusion and fentanyl. Laryngeal mask airway (size 4) with spontaneous ventilation on supplemental oxygen.
Bronchoscopy: Normal upper airway. No visible endobronchial tumor. Mild extrinsic impression at the left mainstem bronchus.
EBUS: Fujifilm EB-530US scope used. Systematic survey completed. Lymph nodes at stations 4L, 7, and 11L identified. A 22G needle was used for TBNA. Four passes were obtained from 7 and 11L, three from 4L. ROSE available and demonstrated abundant lymphocytes in all samples without definite malignant cells.
Elastography not used due to operator preference. No intranodal forceps biopsies performed.
Complications: None. Hemodynamics stable. Estimated blood loss <5 mL.
Disposition: Patient recovered uneventfully and was discharged home after 2 hours of observation with standard postprocedure instructions.

registry_entry.note_text:

Four passes were obtained from 7 and 11L, three from 4L. ROSE available and demonstrated abundant lymphocytes in all samples without definite malignant cells.

Complications: None. Hemodynamics stable. Estimated blood loss <5 mL.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal and hilar staging for left upper lobe adenocarcinoma
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: PET-CT with hypermetabolic LUL mass and mildly enlarged, PET-avid 4L and 7 nodes
registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: All stations with adequate lymphocytes and no definite malignant cells on ROSE
registry_entry.ebus_stations_detail: Three to four passes per station, no complications during sampling.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: EBUS staging for known lung adenocarcinoma
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Mediastinal nodes negative for malignancy on ROSE; final cytology pending
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Oncology and thoracic surgery follow-up to finalize treatment plan after final EBUS cytology

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA of 3 or more stations (4L, 7, 11L sampled).

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA of single mediastinal or hilar node station
Linear EBUS-TBNA of each additional mediastinal or hilar node station

coding_review.rationale: Linear EBUS-TBNA staging of mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes (stations 4L, 7, and 11L) for known left upper lobe adenocarcinoma under MAC with LMA. 31652 is used for the initial nodal station and 31653 for the additional stations; there is no documentation of radial EBUS, peripheral lung ablation, or pleural procedures that would warrant additional bronchoscopic CPT codes.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedures performed: (1) Flexible bronchoscopy with airway inspection, (2) Linear EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal and hilar nodes.
Patient: Robert Lee, 71-year-old male with suspected recurrent small cell lung cancer and new mediastinal adenopathy after chemoradiation.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia, endotracheal tube 8.5 mm, pressure control ventilation.
Bronchoscopic findings: Mild radiation-related mucosal changes. No discrete endobronchial mass. Carina sharp.
EBUS: Olympus BF-UC180F scope. Systematic nodal evaluation. Stations 2R, 4R, 7, and 10R identified. Nodes at 4R and 7 were enlarged. A 21G Vizishot needle was used. Three passes per station at 4R and 7, two passes at 2R and 10R. ROSE showed malignant cells at 7 consistent with small cell carcinoma; other stations with lymphocytes.
Elastography not available on this system. No intranodal forceps biopsies performed.
Complications: None. EBL 10 mL.
Plan: Await final cytology. Given evidence of nodal recurrence, patient will be referred to medical oncology.
Disposition: Extubated in OR, transported to PACU in stable condition and later admitted to oncology ward.

registry_entry.note_text:

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT and PET showing enlarged 4R and 7 lymph nodes with high SUV in previously irradiated field
registry_entry.prior_therapy: Prior chemoradiation to right hilum and mediastinum
registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: Station 7 with malignant cells compatible with small cell carcinoma; others lymphoid
registry_entry.ebus_stations_detail: Three passes per enlarged station. Adequate cellularity on ROSE.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Bronchoscopy and EBUS for nodal recurrence assessment
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Station 7 positive for recurrent small cell carcinoma on ROSE; final cytology pending
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Oncology follow-up for systemic therapy planning

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA of 3 or more stations (2R, 4R, 7, 10R sampled).

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA of single mediastinal or hilar node station
Linear EBUS-TBNA of each additional mediastinal or hilar node station

coding_review.rationale: Linear EBUS-TBNA of multiple mediastinal/hilar stations (including 2R, 4R, 7, and 10R) for suspected nodal recurrence of small cell lung cancer, with station 7 positive on ROSE. 31652 captures the first nodal station and 31653 captures additional stations; no radial EBUS, ablation, or pleural intervention is documented.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Robotic-assisted navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and transbronchial biopsies of a right lower lobe nodule.
Patient: Patricia Nguyen, 67-year-old female, former smoker, with 18 mm RLL peripheral pulmonary nodule and positive PET.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 mm ETT, volume control ventilation.
Navigation: Ion robotic bronchoscopy platform used. CT-to-body surface registration successful with registration error ~3 mm. Planned pathway to superior segment RLL nodule generated.
Radial EBUS: Concentric solid lesion pattern obtained at target.
Sampling: Tool-in-lesion confirmed by cone-beam CT. Six transbronchial forceps biopsies, two brushings, and one 21G needle aspiration performed. No cryobiopsy.
Complications: Mild self-limited bleeding controlled with wedging and cold saline. No pneumothorax on immediate fluoroscopy.
Estimated blood loss: 10 mL.
Disposition: Extubated in procedure room and discharged from PACU after uneventful recovery.

registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Clinic follow-up in 1 week to review final pathology and staging

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy using image-guided navigation
Computer-assisted, image-guided navigational bronchoscopy (add-on)
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe

coding_review.rationale: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS confirmation and multiple transbronchial biopsies, brushings, and needle aspirations of a right lower lobe PET-avid nodule. 31626 captures the navigation-assisted transbronchial lung biopsy work, +31627 captures the separate navigational bronchoscopy add-on, and 31628 reflects additional transbronchial biopsy work as modeled in the internal knowledge base; no ablation or pleural catheter is performed in this case.
